name: The Stop Farmers' Market
description:
The Stop's Farmers' Market is one of the few farmers' markets in Toronto that is open year-round, rain or shine!

We are proud to host over 35 farmers, food artisans and prepared food small independent businesses who center their work around sustainability, ethical labour practices, and local ingredients. You'll find an array of produce, meat, dairy, beverages, pickles and ferments, prepared foods, and more that reflect cultural diversity and local seasonality. 

Our market celebrates community and features weekly pop-ups of new vendors, a community table for advocacy groups and community members to share their cause, and musical performances from local artists.

name: Illumination at Todmorden Mills
description: Enjoy enhanced holiday tours featuring period decorations in the historic houses, which showcase celebrations from the 1890s and 1940s. Visitors can participate in a rotation of themed crafts and games inspired by various traditions. This event focuses on the common threads of light, warmth, and family encouraging visitors to experience the museum as a place of warmth, connection, and personal meaning-making.

name: St. Lawrence Market Farmers' Market
description: Established in 1803, this Saturday Farmers' market is the oldest in the city.  Now in the newly opened North Building, shop and get to know our merchants and farmers who take care to remember what you enjoy, and are always happy to recommend something new.

name: Shrek The Musical
description:
Join Shrek and friends for a holiday you'll never forget!

Enjoy the humour, heart, and hijinks of this ogre-sized production. Bursting with catchy tunes, laugh-out-loud moments, and featuring a kaleidoscopic crew of fairy tale misfits â€“ a wisecracking donkey, a fierce warrior princess, a pint-sized villain, and even a cookie with an attitude. 

It's a fun-filled adventure for the whole family, celebrating friendship and the joy of finding your true self. Based on the smash-hit Oscar-winning film, this charmingly cheeky romp in the swamp reminds us that even in a world divided, we're all in this together.
